definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: I've been a faithful public servant all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生都是一名忠實的人民公僕。

sentences.english: Civil servant used to be a good job. The situation is different now.
sentences.chinese: 公僕曾經不一份理想的工作，現在的情況已經改變。

sentences.english: Anyone can be a servant. All it requires is character.
sentences.chinese: 其實每個人都能成爲公僕，需要的僅僅是一種品性。

sentences.english: Introducing the concept of servant leadership to undergraduate teaching complies with the demands of Chinese contemporary university education.
sentences.chinese: “教師成爲公僕型領導者”是美國新興的教育理念。

sentences.english: See, public servant is afraid of public.
Does evil abuses power, that is the people's public servant.
sentences.chinese: 作惡作威作福，那是人民公僕。

sentences.english: Everyone wants to lead; no one wants to bea servant.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都想成爲領導者，沒有人願意當公僕。

sentences.english: They are the servant leaders of Wal-Mart.
sentences.chinese: 他們纔是沃爾瑪的人民公僕。

sentences.english: She has always been a noble public servant," she said.
sentences.chinese: 她始終是一位品質高尚的公僕。

sentences.english: They were both able, honest public servants.
sentences.chinese: 他們都是能幹而且正直的公僕。

sentences.english: China's a big place with abundant resources, especially when it comes to civil servants.
sentences.chinese: 中國地大物博，尤盛產各類公僕。

sentences.english: Scala was a meritorious public servant.
sentences.chinese: 斯卡拉是一個能幹的國民公僕。

definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
